alert.note: Alert for Collier (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 5:45PM EDT until June 03 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Collier. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 542 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains ongoing over the advisory area which is moving northward. Doppler radar is also indicating another area of heavy rains developing in near-shore Gulf waters of South Florida moving northward which should affect the advisory area through early this evening. Rainfall amounts between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen today over this area, and additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area through early this evening. If these rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood warning may be needed for this area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Naples, Marco Island, Everglades City, Royal Palm Hammock, Marco Island Airport, Cape Romano, Belle Meade, Lely Resort, Naples Manor, East Naples, Plantation Island, Big Cypress National Preserve, Everglades National Park, Goodland, Key Marco, Cape Romano Aquatic Preserve, Port Of The Island, Fiddlers Creek, Rookery Bay Aquatic Preserve and Lely. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
